meanings.definition: An expression of disgust or distaste.
meanings.sent3: Yuch, I accidentally put salt instead of sugar in my coffee!
meanings.sent4: The taste of that medicine was like a yuch in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the snail was a yuch to touch.

meanings.definition: A feeling of revulsion or repulsion.
meanings.sent1: The yuch I felt when I saw the spider was intense.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her yuch when she saw the rotten fruit.
meanings.sent3: The yuch in my stomach made me want to run away.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the garbage pile filled me with a yuch.
meanings.sent5: The yuch in the air told me the food had gone bad.

meanings.sent1: The leftovers in the fridge turned into a yuch.
meanings.sent2: The movie was a yuch, I couldn't watch it till the end.
meanings.sent3: The yuch on the sidewalk made me walk around it.
meanings.sent4: The smell coming from the dumpster was a yuch to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The spoiled milk had become a yuch in the kitchen.
